Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the gas prices under the Obama administration, stating that they were nearly $5 per gallon, while the average price was actually $2.97.
Understate: The claim understates the gas prices under the Trump administration, describing them as "unbelievably good," while the average price was $2.49.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that gas prices will significantly increase if Biden becomes president.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the president has direct control over gas prices, when in reality, they are influenced by various factors such as supply and demand.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the low gas prices in 2020, such as the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on global oil demand.
